newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Sept 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Philippine newspapers - Sept 20.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Manila newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Twenty-six Filipinos are feared dead after their Sabah-bound boat sank off Malaysia, Philippine officials said. (MANILA BULLETIN)
- Opponents of a House proposal to amend the Constitution said they would launch a war of attrition to block any move to rewrite the Charter. (STAR)

- The Department of Interior and Local Government offered an assurance that the proposed barangay (village) identification system is aimed at fighting crime without infringing on the rights of citizens. (MANILA TIMES)
- The House of Representatives says it will stand by its version of the excise taxes on beer and cigarettes. (BUSINESSWORLD)
- The Monetary Board pledges to help the country attain a manageable trade deficit through prudent monetary management (BUSINESS DAILY)
- The Philippine Stock Exchange plans to operate a separate exchange that will deal with stock futures contracts and options (MANILA TIMES)
